extraordinario, tanto su jugabilidad como su historia lo hacen en mi opinion uno de los mejores juegos de la historia y el mejor para mi, por mucho tiempo he sido de fan de la saga bioshock y sus dos primeras entregas son de lo mejor pero infinite tiene una historia que te atrapa y el final es que no te lo esperas, recomendado al 100%, si te gusta una buena historia con un nivel de dificultad mayor de lo normal este es tu juego saludos y espero verte en columbia.

A Masterpiece of storytelling.

From the way the game plays out to the system mechanics themselves, there is nothing "casual" about Bioshock Infinite.
I have never played on "normal" (started on hard), and boy it can get brutal at times.

However, sad as it is, you don't really play this game for the FPS mechanics - the story, with the depth of an ocean is what differentiates the franchise from other FPS single-player games.

Definately a must play for any player that enjoys atmospheric FPS games - and enjoys deep, mature storytelling.
8.5/10

Bioshock Infinite: Una digna secuela que perfecciona la narrativa, pero mediocriza la jugabilidad. 

-Historia: 9/10 (Gran crÃ­tica a la teocracÃ­a que brilla por las representaciones alegÃ³ricas / Fundamentos filosÃ³ficos y psicolÃ³gicos que se basan principalmente en la teoria del "multiverso")

-Jugabilidad: 7/10 (Muy simplificada en contraste con entregas anteriores / Lineal / En diversas ocasiones se siente inÃºtil / Buen manejo de controles / Posee un uso del escenario "promedio" / RestricciÃ³n de armas) 

-GrÃ¡ficos: 8/10 (Columbia se sigue viendo hermosa, lo que sÃ­ ha envejecido son los modelos de los enemigos y personajes secundarios) 

-AtmÃ³sfera: 6/10 (A pesar de la belleza de los escenarios, estos se sienten "Planos" debido a la naturaleza "lineal" del tÃ­tulo / No llegan a la altura de la claustrofobia generada por los primeros Bioshock / El sonido es bueno, pero no excelente / Los escenarios se sienten bastante repetitivos) 

----CALIFICACIÃ“N FINAL: 8 (SÃ­ eres fan de la franquicia, LO DEBES TENER. Si no, cÃ³mpralo en rebajas)

Its an OK game........But it could've been so much better. Good for a one time play and forget but not nearly as good as Bioshock 1 or 2. Kind of a let down really.

Que puedo decir que no haya dicho , me encant, mi juego favorito, el unico que he pasado tres veces , siempre me engancha con su historia y su estetica , si no lo has jugado en esta realidad, HAZLO! , antes de que te sangre la nariz.

Wow, definitely one of the top games. Artwork, musik and mameplay is just awesome. The story has something to say. I can only recommend playing this game even if you are not that much into shooters. 

The balance between action and story is simply perfect. The fights are not that difficult still interesting an challanging boss fights. People who like story driven games are definitely at the right place. 

If you need a challenge, then try it at a higher difficulty level. Certainly a game worth playing through! Get it and enjoy!
El juego es excelente una joya de los juegos
este es el mejor juego de toda la saga de bioshock. lo unico malo de el juego es el guardado automatico/ 07/08/2021 obra maestra
This is pretty immersive, even though the people look weird. Feels just like the first Bioshock, just in a different setting. Game storyline is still filled with weird shit and cool items + vigors.
Fantastik bir dÃ¼nyada biraz beynimi zorlayayÄ±m diyorsan hiÃ§ durma oyna

Playing this game through the first time on Xbox 360 days blew my mind, one of the best twists and mind blowing endings in video games within the last 10 years. Replaying this again on PC, still it blows my mind and honestly looks better on PC than 360/ps3. Bioshock 1 will always hold a place in my heart but this game is just thought provoking, american history rooted (many themes come from 1900's) and the DLC is the final stories in the bioshock saga (till they decide to make another one) easily the best one out of the three bioshock games. Amazing story, solid gun fights and a game/ending that you will never forget. A true steampunk masterpiece. 9/10

ä¼Šä¸½èç™½æˆ‘tmç¤¾ä¿ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼ï¼

Wow! Playing this game for the first time and if I might add it is also my first Bioshock game. Artwork is amazing and the gameplay is very easy to pick up and fun. It drops you in the game not really telling you much and I love it, plus the storyline is very good as well, despite me not even beating the game yet. It reminds me a bit of Fallout 4 with the combat, which is very fun. Sound effects are very pleasing to the ears and the visuals are STUNNING. I am running this on a laptop with low settings and I literally couldn't tell when I started up the game that the graphics were on low. Being an old game though it has it's flaws, a term that I am using losely, and that is mostly in the animation. It seems as if none of the game is in motion capture but just strictly computer animation, which is fine by me but for others it may prove to be unimmersive. Another weird nit pick of mine is the animation for the mouths, the characters when the say anything with "oh" their mouth looks really weird and contorts in a weird way but it's not anything big. Anyway, overall I personally give this game a 8/10, only because I have not personally finished it.

It's a great game with smooth cartoony graphics, good fighting sequence and mechanics, a variety of weapons, and a captivating plot! There was so many details if you are diving into the lore, but also some great combats if you are just aiming for the adrenoline rush! 
The end plot and lore are apparently tied up with other Bioshock games in the franchise, which I haven't played, so I was quite in the dark during the game regarding the lore. The ending was definitely confusing for me! The characters were also heavily involved in the lore. 
If I had the chance, I would definitely replay this game to better understand the plot and lore! 
Surely recommend!

Genre: FPS, adventure
really amazing story and overall great gameplay.

[H1]Unfortunately no Rapture[/H1]
Don't get me wrong, this game is fun to play like the earlier, but the world is not as believable, immersive nor memorable as Rapture.
Does however contain a Rapture DLC which was a welcome surprise.
Buy if you'd enjoy a fun single player shooter with some fun ideas.

Ğ¯ Ğ¿Ñ€Ğ¾ÑˆĞµĞ» ĞµÑ‘ Ğ·Ğ°Ğ»Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ·Ğ° 12 Ñ‡Ğ°ÑĞ¾Ğ² Ğ±ĞµĞ· Ğ¾ÑÑ‚Ğ°Ğ½Ğ¾Ğ²ĞºĞ¸.

I'll begin by saying that while I've played plenty of games (not nearly enough imho), I've never once written a review of one. Not because of lack of enjoyment, but rather because there was nothing more to add that hadn't already been said by other players. Bioshock Infinite made me break this pattern.

This game is as close to perfection as any game could ever come. The story is so good and well thought out that I wish it were a book, the gameplay has its flaws, but I find that most games do, it has stunning views and a superb design, albeit quite creepy in the later stages. Of course, I can't talk about this game's strong points without mentioning the incredible character development. One minute I'm rooting for a character, the next I want to send a bunch of killer crows their way.

Having just finished this game, I am perhaps a bit enthusiastic about it. But you will be too. It's the kind of game that you just want to keep playing, not (only) because of that area you can't seem to kill your way through, but because you need to know what happens next. I wish more games were like this. Though I would certainly be a lot poorer.

What would otherwise be a good game, totally ruined by a checkpoint-only save system. Having wasted about two hours out of the 10.5 hours I've played redoing stuff I'd already done I've had enough. Not only has my time been wasted but the repetition is BORING.

I never fell inlove with a game character this much before. you could tell that they put a lot of work on making elizabeth the best a.i. with how she interact with her sorroundings to assisting you with combat and picking locks it's like you have a really useful companion who got your back.

La ciudad de Columbia es realmente increible, un deleite tanto visual como mecÃ¡nico, porque una de las cosas mÃ¡s destacables del juego es saltar en la cara de los enemigos desde los aerocarriles mientras te desplazas entre la hermosa arquitectura de los edificios flotantes.

Con personajes bien diseÃ±ados y llenos de carisma que se comen cada momento, y una historia que nos muestra la verdadera cara de esta utopÃ­a a medida de que nos sumerge en su mundo...
